title: Can I lose weight while eating French fries? - Quora

response.answer_text: Technically, it’s possible, but you would have to be able to calculate your daily calorie needs, and ensure that the calories you consume for the day are less than the calories you will burn. Let’s say I require 2000 calories per day and I want to lose 1 pound per week. I’d need to eat 500 calories less than what I need for the day every day of this weight loss journey. That’s only 1500 calories I get to eat per day. A medium sized fry at McDonald’s (U.S.A. medium) is about 350 calories. I can eat that batch of fries and have 1150 calories for the rest of the food I eat that day. When people want to lose weight, they typically avoid foods like this because it’s easy to overeat and you won’t feel completely satisfied afterwards. If you want to avoid overeating after the fries, you can add a protein (chicken or tofu). So, eat a little protein when you’re done and boom— you’ve had your fries and now you feel satisfied until the next meal. So, yes. You can totally have fries and lose weight, just keep in mind that you’ll want to eat protein with it. I don’t recommend a burger or something like that for two reasons: the fries are already providing lots of carbs and fat. You just need to balance it with lean protein (like chicken breast, turkey, or lean beef). (Here’s a BMR calculator BMR Calculator. After you calculate your BMR you can go here to determine your daily calorie needs: Harris Benedict Equation.)
